alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Beaverhead, Lemhi Highlands; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS STRETCHING FROM HOWE SOUTH THROUGH MALAD WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND WYOMING BORDER REGION THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Southeast Inl to 12 miles northwest of Shelley to near Rose to near Fort Hall Mount Putnam to Arimo to near Cherry Creek Rest Area. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 35 to 40 mph, pea size hail, and moderate rain with upwards of 0.25 inches per hour observed. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Enhanced runoff is possible where heavier precipitation falls on ripe snow. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Rexburg, Preston, Rigby, Soda Springs, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Ririe Reservoir, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, Blackfoot Reservoir, Wayan, Terreton, Lorenzo, Ammon, Shelley, Iona and Sugar City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If near a swollen stream, move to higher ground.
